_header: Honoured be Thou blissful Lord on high
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, ‘Cantus peregrinorum’, in the English translation of the Pèlerinage de l’âme — five stanzas rhyme royal

Bod770.Transcription:
[H]onourid be þou blisful lord an hyȝþat of þe
                    blissid maiden were I bore…

OxfCCC237.Transcription:
Honoured be þu blisseful lorde an hyghThat of þe blessed
                    maydyn were I bore…

CamGon124.First Lines:
hOnoured be þu blisful lord on hyeþat of þe blisful
                    mayden were bore…
CamGon124.Last Lines:
…To the we com as fyn off oure LaboureWham wilnith eueri trew
                    trauayloure
CamGon124.Attributed Title: And þis was the noble song þat I herd hem syng (p. 38)

CULKk17.First Lines:
Honoured be þou blysful lord on hyÞat of þe blisful
                    mayde were bore…
CULKk17.Last Lines:
…To þe come3 as fyn of our labourAnd so schal eny trewe
                    traueylour
CULKk17.Attributed Title:
her endith þe drem of þe pilgrimage of þe soule (f.
                        124v)

BLAdd34193.First Lines:
Honourede be þou blistefull lorde and hyeþou blisse de
                    maide were ybore…
BLAdd34193.Last Lines:
…To þe we come os ende of oure laburWhom desireth euer
                    trwe traueloure

                        ed.  
             “An Edition of British Museum MS Additional 37049: a Religious
                Miscellany.”

BLEge615.First Lines: Honowred be thu blissed lord on hyeThat of the blisful mayde were I bore…
BLEge615.Last Lines: …To the we come as fyne of oure laboureWhom willeth eueri trewe trauayloure

                        ed.

                    were ybore…
NYPLSpenc19.Last Lines:
